CRLCS05011-d-03-02-05-CRL.Narrative: CREW WAS COMING DOWN THE HILL WITH 26 LOADS AND 18 EMPTIES OFF THE BRC AND NS. SHORTLY AFTER PASSINGOVER 100TH ST., CREW REPORTED LOSING THE AIR AND COMING TO AN ABRUPT STOP. INSPECTION REVEALED THE26TH THROUGH 29TH CARS DERAILED AND TIPPED TO THE EAST.  ALL FOUR CARS WERE LOADED WITH WHEAT FOR NIDERA.  DRUG AND ALCOHOL TESTING WAS NEGATIVE.

CRLCS05014-d-03-07-05-CRL.Narrative: CREW WAS PERFORMING SWITCHING OFF OF THE CW MAIN INTO IRONDALE YARD. AFTER MAKING 2 PASSES SETTING OUT 7 CARS, ENGINEER INFORMED CONDUCTOR THAT TRAIN WAS HARD TO SHOVE. AT THIS TIME INSPECTION OF TRAIN DETERMINED THAT THERE WAS A 6 CAR DERAILMENT. CREW WAS SWITCHING IN A SOUTHWARD DIRECTION INTO IRONDALE YARD. THE TRAIN DID NOT GO INTO EMERGENCY,STOP WAS BROUGHT ABOUT BY EXTREME HARD SHOVING CONDITIONS. CAUSE DETERMINED TO BE WIDE GAUGE.  DRUG AND ALCOHOL TESTING WAS NEGATIVE.

CRLCS05016-d-03-12-05-CRL.Narrative:
CREW WAS PULLING TWO BAD ORDER ENGINES,3 LOADS AND 4 EMPTIES OUT OF PORT TRACK #1 HEADED FOR THE NSYARD.   AS THEY WERE APPROACHING THE ROAD CROSSING INTO THE PORT YARD, THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY.   CREW WALKED BACK AND FOUND THE TRAILING UNIT ON THE GROUND ALONG WITH 2 EMPTIES AND 2 LOADS.   BOTH CREW MEMBERS SAY THEY DID NOT FEEL ANYTHING THAT WOULD INDICATE THAT THEY WERE ON THE GROUND PRIOR TO GOING INTO EMERGENCY.   ENGINEER STATES HE WAS TRAVELLING AT 8MPH AND AS HE ADVANCED TONOTCH 4HE FELT A TUG.
 CAUSE WAS DETERMINED TO BE EXCESSIVE SPEED.   DRUG AND ALCOHOL TESTING WAS NEGATIVE.

I0205-d-03-18-05-PATH.Contributing Accident Cause: Other causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
I0205-d-03-18-05-PATH.Narrative: SWITCHING ENGINEER WAS MOVING WEST ON TRACK 5 AT HARRISON CAR MAINTENANCE FACILITY INTO THE BLOWDOWNPIT WITH A CONSIST OF FOUR CARS.  CARS WERE 606-145-165-604.  THE SWITCHING ENGINEER STOPPED AT THETRAIN STOP #Y5APB TO LOWER THE TRIPPER BEFORE PROCEEDING.  WHEN SHE TRIED TO STOP THE TRAIN AT THEDESIGNATED LOCATION, SHE WAS UNABLE TO STOP.  SHE APPLIED FULL SERVICE BRAKES AND PLACED THE TRAIN INTO EMERGENCY WHEN SHE FELT IT SLIDE.  THE TRAIN STRUCK THE DOOR AT THE WEST END.  THE TRAIN PROTRUDED APPOXIMATELY FOUR FEET PAST THE DOOR WHEN IT STOPPED.  THE SWITCHING ENGINEER WAS NOT INJURED ANDWAS ESCORTED FOR D&A TESTING.  INSPECTION OF THE SITE INDICATES A LARGE AMOUNT OF GREASE ON THE RAILS.  THE BLOWDOWN PIT IS USED TO CLEAN THE UNDER-CARRIAGE OF CARS.  THE SUBSTANCE ON THE RAILS IS ACOMBINATION OF KELTRACK, USED IN THE TRACK MACHINES AND SOYTRAK A CURVE LUBICANT GREASE.  THE GREASEON THE RAILS IN THIS AREA IS A NORMAL OCCURANCE AND SPEED ENTERING THE SHOP IS RESTRICTED TO 5MPH.OTHER EMPLOYEES ALLEGE THE SLIPPERY CONDITIONS ON THE RAILS WAS EVIDENT THE DAY BEFORE, BUT IT WASREPORTED UNTIL AFTER THIS INCIDENT.  TOTAL DAMAGE IS ESTIMATED AT $35,700.

095941-d-03-23-05-PCMZ.Narrative: CALTRAIN NO.#325 OPERATING WITH CAB CAR 112 IN THE LEAD, 4 CARS, AND LOCOMOTIVE 926 IN PUSH MODE, STRUCK AN AUTOMOBILE WHICH WAS REAR-ENDED BY ANOTHER AUTOMOBILE PROPELLING IT ONTO THE TRACKS.  THE INCIDENT OCCURRED AT MP33.33, CHARLESTON RD CROSSING.

0318052-d-03-18-05-PHL.Narrative: PHL 38/37 WAS WANTING TO HEAD TOWARDS TRACK 300 HOWEVER UP 2156 WAS BLOCKING THEIR WAY. PHL 38/37 ASKED UP 2156 TO BACK UP TOWARDS TRACK 308 SO THAT THEY COULD GET BY THEM. UP 2156 DID BACK UP AND A CONDUCTOR ON THE PHL 38/37 PROCEEDED TO LINE A SWITCH THAT WOULD TAKE THEM TOWARDS TRACK 300. THE CONDUCTOR WHO WAS SITTING IN THE REAR OF THE 2 LOCOMOTIVES INDICATED, USING HAND SIGNALS, THAT THE ENGINEER SHOULD MAKE SHOVING MOVEMENT TOWARDS TRACK 300. AS THEY NEARED TO WHERE UP 2156 HAD BACKED AWAYFROM, THE CONDUCTOR NOTICED THAT THE UP 2156 WAS FOULING THE LEAD. THE CONDUCTOR ALLEGEDLY INDICATED THE ENGINEER SHOULD STOP VIA HAND SIGNALS BUT WHEN THE ENGINEER DIDN`T RESPOND HE TRIED RADIO COMMUNICATION. THE ENGINEER STATES HE NEVER SAW THE HAND SIGNAL NOR HEARD THE RADIO TRANSMISSION AND THE2 CONSISTS OF LITE POWER COLLIDED.

01-d-03-18-05-POTB.Narrative: AT MP 804.7, CONDUCTOR OBSERVED THE REAR TRUCK ON THE BALLAST CAR AND THE LEAD TRUCK ON THE CENTER BEAM BEHIND IT HAD DERAILED.  CONDUCTOR IMMEDIATELY GAVE INSTRUCTIONS VIA RADIO TO STOP THE TRAIN.  AFTER STOPPING, THE DERAILED CARS LEANED OVER ON THEIR SIDES AND ROLLED OVER, DUMPING THE TRAINLINE AIR IN THE PROCESS.  THE TRAIN WAS NOT PLACED INTO EMERGENCY DURING THE STOP.  UPON INSPECTION, CONDUCTOR FOUND THAT THE FOUR CARS BEHIND THE TWO DERAILED CARS HAD ALSO TIPPED OVER, OUT OF VIEW BEHINDTHE TREES IN THE CURVE.  CONDUCTOR COMMUNICATED THE INFORMATION TO ENGINEER, BUT MISCOUNTED THE NUMBER OF ROLLED OVER CARS AS FOUR CENTER BEAMS RATHER THAN FIVE.  A CORRECT COUNT WAS GIVEN LATER IN THE DAY, BUT THE PROBLEM WAS COMPOUNDED BY A MISCOMMUNICATION BETWEEN ENGINEER AND CONDUCTOR, ENGINERRHAVING BELIEVED THAT CONDUCTOR SAID FOUR CARS TOTAL WERE ON THEIR SIDES, NOT FOUR CENTER BEAMS PLUSTHE BALLAST CAR.  THE BOXCAR AHEAD OF THE BALLAST CAR ALSO HAD DERAILED ONE TRUCK, BUT DID NOT TIPOVER.  AFTER TYING NINE HANDBRAKES ON THE REMAINING 18 CARS THAT WERE STRANDED BEHIND THE DERAILMENT, AND SECURING THE BOXCAR THAT HAD PARTIALLY DERAILED, WE CUT AWAY AND PROCEEDED TO COCHRAN WITH THETWO LEADING BOXCARS TO AWAIT FURTHER INSTRUCTIONS.

190670-d-03-30-05-SOO.Primary Accident Cause: Other extreme environmental conditions (Provide detailed description in narrative)
190670-d-03-30-05-SOO.Accident Cause: Other extreme environmental conditions (Provide detailed description in narrative)
190670-d-03-30-05-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 182-30 WAS TRAVELING EAST AND ENCOUNTERED A VERY ROUGH SEGMENT OF TRACK.  ENGINEER ATTEMPTED TO SLOW DOWN USING DYNAMIC BRAKING, GOT INTO DYNAMIC #1, BUT SHORTLY AFTER THE AIR WENT INTO EMERGENCY.   UPON INSPECTION CONDUCTOR DISCOVERED 15 CARS DERAILED. NO INJURIES. NO HAZMAT INVOLVED. DERAILED CARS ARE REPORTED TO BE ON THEIR SIDES AND DOWN ALONG A RAVINE.  INITIAL CAUSE SUSPECTED AS WASHOUT DUE TO EXTREME AMOUNTS OF RAIN THAT DAY. ENGINEERING INVESTIGATION ADVISES SUBGRADE BECAME SATURATED WITH WATER, SIGNIFICANTLY WEAKENING THE SOIL STRENGTH AND CAUSING THE SUBGRADE TO FAIL. A FROST LAYER ON THE NORTH FACING SLOPE OF THE EMBANKMENT WAS AN IMPEDEMENT TO NATURAL DRAINAGE OF THE SUBGRADE, EFFECTIVELY TRAPPING WATER WITHIN THE EMBANKMENT. OVERLAND FLOW FROM A NEIGHBORING PROPERTY INTRODUCED LARGER THAN NORMAL AMOUNTS OF WATER TO AN AREA THAT DID NOT NORMALLY RECEIVE CONCENTRATED SURFACE FLOW.  ADDITIONAL INFORMATION PROVIDED 5/6/05 - ADDITIONAL CONTRIBUTING FACTOR - DERAILING TRAIN NOT ADVISED OF POSSIBLE HAZARDOUS OR UNSAFE TRACK CONDITION AS REPORTED BY PREVIOUS TRAIN.  DISPATCHER BULLETIN ISSUED 3/31/05 PROVIDING INSTRUCTION TO DISPATCHERS ON HOW TO HANDLE RECEIPT OF REPORTS OF SUSPECTED UNSAFE TRACK CONDITION.

311-d-03-28-05-FGLK.Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)
311-d-03-28-05-FGLK.Narrative: GY 1 CREW ON DUTY AT 0700 AM.  CREW TIED ON TO 43 CARS FROM NORTH END TO BEGIN SWITCHING OUT INBOUND.  WHEN TIEING ON TO TRAIN ON TRACK #1 (43 CARS), WHEN TRAIN WAS SUFFICIENTLY AIRED UP, SLACK ALLOWED REAR TO ROLL 1 TRUCK THROUGH MISALIGNED SWITCH IN A SOUTH DIRECTION.  WHEN THE CREW REVERSED DIRECTION TO GO NORTH THE REAR CAR SPLIT THE #1 -#2 SWITCH.  WHEN REACHING THE #2 AND #3 SWITCH IT DERAILED AND PULLED LATERALLY TOWARD TRACK #1 DERAILING A LOAD AHEAD OF IT.  THE CARS HIT AND OVERTURNED ALOAD SITTING AT THE FOULING POINT TRACK #2 AND CORNERED 1 ADDITIONAL CAR BEFORE GOING INTO EMERGENCY. DOWN LOADED EVENT RECORDER AND G.P.S READOUT. WINTERS RETAILING CALLED TO SCENE ON 3/29/05.

2005071-d-03-19-05-ICE.Narrative: MSPKC18 CREW WAS EASTBOUND ON BNSF #2 MAIN TRACK WHEN IT DERAILED 21 CARS.  THE CREW WAS NOT DRUG/ALCOHOL TESTED.  CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT WAS DETERMINED TO BE T111 (WIDE GAGE DUE TO DEFECTIVE OR MISSING SPIKES OR OTHER RAIL FASTENERS) AS DETERMINED BY BNSF PERSONNEL.  THERE WERE HAZARDOUS CARS IN THE CONSIST, TWO OF WHICH WERE DERAILED.  THERE WAS NO RELEASE OF HAZARDOUS MATERIALS AND THERE WERENO PEOPLE EVACUATED DUE TO THIS INCIDENT.
